Description: Whip with hollow shaft holding a stiletto knife-dagger made of steel (?). Handle of knife is made of wood covered with strips of tightly bound leather. Single leather strap at one side. Knife screws into hollow wood shaft which is decorated externally with inlaid pieces of wood, mother-of-pearl and ivory in geometric patterns. Whip is made of interlaced strips of leather, tapering towards lower end and terminating in a short strap.
Acquisition notes: Offered as a possible gift on 12 January 1966 (receipt number 653). However, not entered into donations book. Later note by William Fagg, Dept of Ethnography (12 July 1974) indicates that it should be incorporated into the collections.
